content.description: Climb up the last seam to the right of Big Meech to the positive ledges and the classic slopey topout.
content.protection: A single crash pad should be fine.
content.location: Last line to the right of Big Meech.

content.description: Same start as Red Sea, but go directly up the arete.
content.location: Same start as Red Sea. Climbs the face directly to the right of Armageddon 5000.

content.description: start low and left. make a few moves on whatever holds feel best to a hard move to gain a good hold in the middle of the face.  keep moving right then up the heady, somewhat slopey topout
content.location: backside of boulder. start on good holds down and to the left. the problem starts heading straight up to top out right above the detached boulder on the ground.

content.description: Moses starts on a horizontal edge/pinch to the right of Red Sea. Move left to a crimp and then pull a large lock off move to intersect with Red Sea. Finish up on Red Sea.
content.location: Moses starts directly to the right of Red Sea.

content.description: Based on "Secrets of So iLL" video: Start in middle of the wall and dyno to gaston-jug (crux). Lower start on crimps may exist.
content.location: Red Sea boulder, the wall to the left of the slopey rail for Cain and Ankle.

content.description: Sit start and climb up slopey rail using some crimps out left.
content.location: Left side of scooped face on back of Red Sea Boulder.

content.description:
This is a link up of Moses into Big Mitch.

 Sit Start as per Moses, but instead of topping out once you get the giant sidepull jug, Â continue rightwards and slightly down into the start of Big MItch and then finish as per that problem.

 Just as with "Big D" I doubt this is a First Ascent, but posting it as such is the most surefire way to get a discussion going about it. Who did this first, what did they name it, and what was their grade opinion?
content.location: Sit Start the same as Moses, then after the 1st half of Moses, continue over into Big Mitch and finish on Big Mitch.

content.description: Start matched on a pedestal ledge, climb right on good edges, finish it off with a large throw to a good sloper.
content.location: Between Red Sea and King Solomon.

content.description: Start on horiztanal holds with hands crossed, then reach up to the seem to the left, paste your foot and fight your way up using nasty slopers.
content.location: Starts the right Cain an Ankle. Obvious bulge looking problem.

content.description:
This is a link up of Red Sea into Big Mitch.

 Sit Start as per Red Sea, but instead of topping out once you get the giant sidepull jug after the hard bit of Red Sea, continue rightwards and slightly down into the start of Big MItch and then finish as per that problem.

 I doubt this is a First Ascent, but posting it as such is the most surefire way to get a discussion going about it. Who did this first, what did they name it, and what was their grade opinion?
content.location: Sit Start the same as Red Sea, then do the first half of Red Sea, then continue over into Big Mitch and finish on Big Mitch.

content.description: Start low on two jugs, throw a heel toe cam in, match the left and work your way through a series of pinches and slopers. This problem isn't over till you've topped it out.
content.location: Armageddon 5000 starts to the left of Red Sea.

content.description: stand alone boulder with (at least) 3 phenomenal lines on it.
